title: The Evolution of Data Storage
description: A journey through the geological layers of computing history

eras.name: The Physical Age

milestones.event: IBM 305 RAMAC - First commercial hard disk

eras.libraryMetaphor: Stone tablets in a vault—permanent, tangible, one record per card
eras.physicalDetail: 80 columns, 12 rows. Light shines through holes to read bits. Drop the deck and lose your data order.

eras.name: The Magnetic Age
eras.libraryMetaphor: Scrolls in a linear archive—must read from beginning to find your record
eras.physicalDetail: Iron oxide coating on plastic tape. Hierarchical and network models emerge. Physical pointers = physical addresses.

eras.name: The Spinning Disk Era
eras.libraryMetaphor: Card catalog system—indexed access to any record
eras.physicalDetail: Magnetic domains on aluminum platters. B-tree indexes enable SQL. RAID arrays provide redundancy.

eras.name: The Flash Revolution
eras.libraryMetaphor: Instant digital catalog—search and retrieve in microseconds
eras.physicalDetail: NAND flash cells trap electrons in floating gates. 3D stacking puts terabytes in your pocket.

eras.name: The Cloud Era
eras.libraryMetaphor: Digital library that materializes books on demand, anywhere in the world
eras.physicalDetail: Object stores chunk data across thousands of drives. Erasure coding provides durability. You never see the hardware.
